sentences.sContent: The ship was hung up on a sandbar.
sentences.sContent_eng: The ship was hung up on a sandbar.

sentences.sContent: Without the fungi, this would be just another sandbar.
sentences.sContent_eng: Without the fungi, this would be just another sandbar.
sentences.sCn: 如果没有真菌，这里将成为另一个沙洲。

sentences.sContent: What took my breath away was the almost one kilometer-long sandbar that stretched away from the island itself.
sentences.sContent_eng: What took my breath away was the almost one kilometer-long sandbar that stretched away from the island itself.
sentences.sCn: 让我感到美得几乎窒息的是那长达近一千米的沙洲，自岛身延展出去。

trans.tranOther: A sandbar is a sandbank which is found especially at the mouth of a river or harbour
